cards.body: General optimization and engine improvements to increase stability and performance for players. Includes the investigation and resolution of possible memory leaks and performance spikes.

cards.name: Drake Cutlass Red Rework
cards.description: Implementing the Cutlass Red into the game.
cards.body: Building, balancing, and implementing the medical variant into the game.

cards.name: Prison Uniform
cards.description: Creating a uniform for Players to wear while incarcerated.
cards.body: Prison uniform that will be provided to incarcerated Players serving a sentence.

cards.name: Klescher Automated Prison
cards.description: Creation and implementation of an automated prison facility into the game.
cards.body: Owned and operated by Klescher Rehabilitation Facilities, a private corrections provider, this fully automated corrections site includes housing, security, and work release opportunities to allow prisoners to be productive while paying their debt to society.

cards.name: Prison Missions
cards.description: Designing and implementing missions set within in-game prisons.
cards.body: Designing and implementing various missions set within in-game prisons around the universe.

cards.name: New Babbage Landing Zone - Interiors
cards.description: Implementing the first version of the New Babbage landing zone into the game
cards.body: Enclosed to protect the inhabitants against the freezing elements, New Babbage is a major social and economic trading hub on microTech. Although it features microTech’s flagship store, the landing zone is also a haven for smaller tech companies.

cards.name: Mission Giver: Eddie Parr
cards.description: Creating and implementing a new mission giver
cards.body: Creating a new mission giver for microTech. Includes concepting, motion capture, animation, audio, behaviors, mission content, and the creation of clothing, props, and environment. Also includes the writing of accompanying mission text.

cards.name: Door System Improvements
cards.description: Updating the existing door system and adding new functionalities
cards.body: Reworking the door technology to work in conjunction with Object Container Streaming and improving synchronization across clients. Adding new functionalities for animation, audio and VFX to improve look and feel.

cards.name: Dynamic Mission System: Economy Generated Missions
cards.description: The Dynamic Mission System allows content to be dynamically tailored to the current environment
cards.body: The Dynamic Mission System allows missions featuring specific locations, rewards, and other parameters to be dynamically dictated based upon guidance from the back-end simulation and player actions, which in turn enables a more systemic universe.

cards.name: Drake Cutlass Blue Rework
cards.description: Implementing the Cutlass Blue into the game
cards.body: Building, balancing, and implementing the police/militia patrol variant of the Drake Cutlass into the game.

cards.name: Dynamic Mission System: Mission Generation along QT Routes
cards.description: Implementing the Dynamic Mission System, allowing for the real-time customization of mission content
cards.body: The Dynamic Mission System will allow for the real-time customization of mission content based upon direction from the macro economy. This will include the ability to vary where missions are offered, in what quantity, and the payment.  It will also allow mission templates to be injected with environmental information at run-time, enabling the creation of content that's both more diverse and that more accurately represents the simulated universe at that moment in time.

cards.name: Commodity Transfer Timers
cards.description: Adding conditional timers to automatic loading and unloading of cargo
cards.body: The automatic loading and unloading of cargo will require time to complete, with the duration dependent upon the location, the current level of demand for such services, whether an additional fee to expedite the process has been paid, and the quantity of material being transferred.  Ships will be unavailable until such processes have completed.

cards.name: FPS Combat: Weapon Types
cards.description: The ability for the combat AI to engage the player using a wider arsenal of weaponry
cards.body: Adding the ability for combat AI to engage the player using a wider variety of weaponry, react dynamically to both player behavior and the environment, and engage strategically and realistically.

cards.name: Bounty Hunter Armor
cards.description: Implementing the Bounty Hunter armor set
cards.body: Implementing the armor set traditionally associated with bounty hunters and their ilk.

cards.name: Accounting App
cards.description: Designing and implementing the Accounting App
cards.body: The Accounting App displays a variety of information about a player's active financial commitments, including recurring rentals, insurance, organization membership fees and the associated benefits, etc. It also allows for such commitments to be extended or cancelled.

cards.name: Large-Scale Shadow Improvements
cards.description: Improvements to shadow system allowing for multiple large-scale shadow maps
cards.body: Improvements to the shadow system to allow multiple large-scale shadow maps as opposed to the single large-scale map we currently use. Includes support for large-scale shadows to be dynamic for use on capital ships.

cards.name: Economy Display Terminals
cards.description: Designing and implementing economy display terminals into the game
cards.body: Economy display terminals are billboards that allow for the real-time display of economic information including commodity prices, available missions and payments, retail sale events, area threat levels, etc.

cards.name: Gemini C54 Ballistic SMG
cards.description: Creation and implementation of new FPS weapon
cards.body: Designing and creating Gemini's C54 SMG for use by characters in-game. Work covers concept completion, asset creation, passes by Animation, Audio and VFX, as well as Design input on weapon balance.

cards.name: Lightning Bolt Co. Yubarev Electron Pistol
cards.description: Creation and implementation of new FPS weapon
cards.body: Designing and creating Lightning Bolt Co. Yubarev pistol for use by characters in-game. Work covers concept completion, asset creation, passes by Animation, Audio and VFX, as well as Design input on weapon balance.

cards.name: microTech Moon: Calliope
cards.description: Building and populating Calliope
cards.body: The creation and implementation of microTech's moon, Calliope. Includes constructing outposts and populating the moon's surface.

cards.name: Performance Optimization
cards.description: Performance improvements to increase framerates across all PC specs
cards.body: General optimization and engine improvements to increase stability and performance for players. Includes the investigation and resolution of possible memory leaks and performance spikes.

cards.name: PvP Bounties
cards.description: Players can hunt other players with bounties.
cards.body: Additions to gameplay to allow players to hunt other players with bounties on their heads.

cards.name: Drake Vulture
cards.description: Implementing the Drake Vulture into the game
cards.body: Building, balancing, and implementing Drake Interplanetary's light salvage ship, the Vulture into the game.

cards.name: Klaus & Werner Sledge Mass Driver Revision
cards.description: Updating the ship weapon to latest version
cards.body: Covers all tasks associated with updating the Klaus & Werner Sledge Series Mass Driver (S1-3).

cards.name: microTech Moon: Clio
cards.description: Building and populating Clio
cards.body: The creation and implementation of microTech's moon, Clio. Includes constructing outposts and populating the moon's surface.

cards.name: Death Animation Improvements
cards.description: Combining animation with physical ragdoll simulation
cards.body: Combining updated ragdoll properties with the animation system to make the death reactions of players and NPCs more realistic. This will be achieved by blending death animations with physical ragdoll simulation.

cards.name: NPC Improvements: Civilian
cards.description: Improvement of the Civilian NPC to allow for additional behavior
cards.body: Improvements to the Civilian AI archetype, including additional interactions for the player as well as other NPCs. This will include passes from animation and audio.

cards.name: microTech Moon: Euterpe
cards.description: Building and populating Euterpe
cards.body: The creation and implementation of microTech's moon, Euterpe. Includes constructing outposts and populating the moon's surface.

cards.name: Player Status System v1
cards.description: Expansion of the core mechanics that track player status and well-being
cards.body: The player status tracks the various well-being attributes of a character, including health, stamina, and oxygen levels. This system is expanded to include thirst, hunger and temperature. These values will have knock-on effects for player stamina and ability. AI behaviors will use this system to make intelligent decisions based on their own condition or the condition of others.

cards.name: Lightning Bolt Co. Atzkav Electron Sniper Rifle
cards.description: Creation and implementation of the new FPS weapon
cards.body: Designing and creating the Lightning Bolt Co. Atzkav Electron Sniper Rifle. Includes asset creation, animation, and balancing.

cards.name: Repair/Refuel/Restock Kiosks v1
cards.description: The service kiosk will provide players with a more flexible interface for ship services
cards.body: The service kiosk will receive a more flexible interface for players looking to purchase services and maintenance, including the repair, refueling, and restocking of their ships.

cards.name: FPS: Cover Usage v1
cards.description: The ability for NPCs to use environmental elements as partial cover when engaging an enemy
cards.body: Expanding the tactic selection for the NPC-Human Combat to analyse the environment and detect, in absence of full cover, possible positions where they can engage enemies without being fully exposed to them. This includes objects such as small crates, which could potentially provide partial cover.

cards.name: Bounty Mission NPC Improvements
cards.description: Improvements to bounty mission NPC behavior
cards.body: Additions to the space bounty mission type that allow hunted NPCs to use quantum travel to evade the player.

cards.name: Rest Stop Space Station - Unoccupied
cards.description: Implementing unoccupied Rest Stop space stations into the game
cards.body: Typically found in less-traveled locations, these variants have basic fuel and repair functionality but minimal crew, security, and shopping opportunities. Includes derelict (but not necessarily empty) stations permanently closed by the owners.

cards.name: Origin m50 Improvements
cards.description: Implementing the revised m50 into the game
cards.body: Implementing and balancing the reworked base model of Origin's m50 racer to make it flight-ready in the game. Work on this task will include improvements to landing gear compression and updating the cockpit UI metrics to improve pilot experience.

cards.name: Mission Giver: Lisa Gibbs
cards.description: Creating and implementing a new mission giver
cards.body: Creating a new mission giver duo for Crusader (Gibbs is Devin Bautista's partner). Includes concepting, motion capture, animation, audio, behaviors, mission content, and the creation of clothing, props, and environment. Also includes the writing of accompanying mission text.

cards.name: Ship AI: Atmospheric Combat
cards.description: Adding the ability for AI pilots to take advantage of planetary data and fight within atmosphere
cards.body: AI ships have the proper functionality and behavior to navigate and fight in atmosphere by taking into account concepts like lift, drag, or energy potential. Ships will correctly navigate terrain layout and objects on planets as well.

cards.name: Crusader
cards.description: The design, creation, and implementation of the Gas Giant, Crusader. Includes points of interest around the planet
cards.body: Stanton II is Crusader, a low-mass gas giant that has an atmosphere which is breathable at high altitudes. Taking advantage of this, the planet became home to a military-constructed latticework of inhabitable floating platforms. The platforms proved to be ideal for Crusader, since normally their large-scale commercial transport ships would otherwise need to be built at a greater cost in space. Once Crusader Industries purchased the planet from the UEE, these platforms were further expanded upon to suit their production needs and are now used to build massive ships like the Starliner, Starlifter and Star Runner.

cards.name: Mission Giver: Devin Bautista
cards.description: Creating and implementing a new mission giver
cards.body: Creating a new mission giver duo for Crusader (Bautista is Lisa Gibbs' partner). Includes concepting, motion capture, animation, audio, behaviors, mission content, and the creation of clothing, props, and environment. Also includes the writing of accompanying mission text.

cards.name: Orison Landing Zone
cards.description: Implementing the Orison landing zone into the game
cards.body: With a webbing of eerily beautiful shipyards constructing Crusader ships suspended in mid-atmosphere, Orison is considered by many to be the most picturesque port in the Stanton system. As the main landing zone on Crusader, in addition to the shipyards, its latticework of platforms houses the company's headquarters and employee habitation area. Beyond Crusader's commercial needs, many tourists visit the world (often brought there by Crusader's own Genesis Starliners) looking to experience the stunning vistas offered by Orison's verdant gardens and the gas giant's clouds below.

cards.name: NPC Scheduler
cards.description: The system that controls NPC spawning and population
cards.body:
The NPC Scheduler is meant to add and remove NPCs to the Game, dynamically spawning them into and out of based on NPC Archetype, determining the maximum number of NPCs in a Given area (based on a ratio of players in the area and server performance), and the probabilities of those NPC Archetypes.

NPCs will need to spawn in a 'Spawn Locker' for every Landing Zone, spawning in a hidden location that is impassable by a player such as an invisible barrier or more likely an air-shield or turnstile that cannot be used by players.

cards.name: Crusader Hercules Starlifter
cards.description: Implementing the Crusader Hercules Starlifter into the game
cards.body: Implementing and balancing the Crusader Hercules Starlifter to make it flight-ready in the game.

cards.name: Shield Systems Tech Replacement
cards.description: Replacement of the legacy shield system with Signed Distance Fields tech
cards.body: Replacement of the legacy shield setup system with the new Signed Distance Field tech to allow for the future implementation of more dynamic, form-fitting visuals and effects, as well as improved performance for collision.

cards.name: FPS: Combat Behaviors v2
cards.description: Improvements to FPS combat to enable NPCs to fight in a more believable way
cards.body: Creating varied and believable combat behaviors for enemy AI to adopt in battle. The AI will not only use a variety of weapons to create different combat situations but will have different ways to engage the player, whether in groups or solo. This task also includes creating varying levels of combat training and skill sets for specific areas or situations.

cards.name: Zero-G Push & Pull
cards.description: Zero-g traversal without EVA, using the player's hands
cards.body: Adding the ability for the player to traverse surfaces in zero-g by pushing and pulling with their hands. This will come into play when the player is wearing an EVA suit without thrusters, or if thrusters are turned off.

cards.name: Server to Client Actor Networking Rework
cards.description: Networking improvements to better communicate player actions from the server to the client
cards.body: Improvements to the downstream part of the actor networking responsible for communicating actor state from the server down to clients. This will improve the positioning and movement of other players and NPCs on your client, with improved dead reckoning, helping to reduce perceived lag and instances of rubber-banding.

cards.name: Ship-to-Station Docking
cards.description: Implementing the ability to dock ships to space stations
cards.body: Adding the ability to dock and spawn vehicles connected to space stations. This functionality is required for some of the larger ships to spawn at certain locations.

cards.name: Multicrew - Expanded Pilot Role
cards.description: Adding the ability for pilots to receive and follow orders
cards.body: Pilots will be able to receive instructions and view information in order to follow specific instruction. For example, moving to a designated area or Quantum Travelling to a specific point.

cards.name: Security System
cards.description: Adding security systems that control access to private areas/objects
cards.body: The security system controls who has access to areas and objects based on various factors such as reputation, ownership, keycards, and faction. It will automatically issue warnings to people breaking the law and, if ignored, will flag them as criminals to security forces.

cards.name: Flight AI: Improvements and Polishing
cards.description: Final touches on flight combat and behaviors
cards.body: This polishing pass contains final work on behaviors and balancing as well as bug fixing. Goal is to improve the look and feel of flight combat for the release.

cards.name: Multicrew - Expanded Turret Gunner Role
cards.description: Adding the ability for turret gunners to receive targets and follow orders
cards.body: Turret Gunners will be able to receive specific target designations from other players and track them independently of their own targets.

cards.name: FPS: Combat Improvements and Polishing
cards.description: Final touches to the combat AI
cards.body: This polishing pass contains final work on behaviors and balancing as well as bug fixing. Goal is to improve the look and feel of character combat for the release.

cards.name: Behring GP-33 Grenade Launcher
cards.description: Creation and implementation of the new FPS weapon
cards.body: Designing and creating the Behring GP-33 grenade launcher. Includes asset creation, animation, and balancing.

cards.name: Salvage v1
cards.description: The ability to collect material from ship hulls
cards.body: Designing and implementing mechanics required for players to be able to strip material from a ship's hull. This system will be designed to accommodate players who are on foot or in a ship.  The player will have to scan the environment to find salvageable debris. Once harvested, unrefined materials can be sold at a kiosk.

cards.name: NPC Healing
cards.description: Healing other players and NPCs
cards.body: Expanding the healing gameplay to allow the player to use items with healing properties (like the MedPen) on other players and NPCs.
